tags.name: Bank Accounts
tags.description: Bank account objects are created to store bank account data. These objects describe characteristics of bank accounts, such as the account name, number, and type. You can get and list bank accounts using these endpoints. Bank accounts are identified by an id.

tags.name: Collect Sessions
tags.description: Collect sessions allow you to automate each step of your document collection process, from customer contact to fraud checks and verification. Sessions are identified by an id.

tags.name: Credit Insights
tags.description: Credit Insights provides inferred creditworthiness datapoints relating to a specific customer or bank account.

tags.name: Customers
tags.description: Customer objects are created to easily track and store documents. You can create, get, update, delete, and list your customers. Customers are identified by an id.

tags.name: Documents
tags.description: Document objects are created to store a document. You can create, get, delete, and list your documents against a customer. Documents are identified by an id.

tags.name: Open Banking
tags.description: This endpoint allows you to associate open banking data with an Inscribe customer. There are 2 types of open banking data supported: Plaid and MX. Credit insights for this customer are then generated from this data.

tags.name: Transactions
tags.description: Transaction objects are created to store transaction data. These objects describe characteristics of transactions, such as the date, amount, description, and category. You can list all of your transactions using these endpoints. Transactions are identified by an id.

get.description: Returns a list of bank accounts for a customer. The list is sorted by creation date, with the most recently created bank accounts appearing first.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The Inscribe customer id.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Set the number of bank accounts to be returned by request.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: A cursor to retrieve the next set of bank accounts, starting after the cursor. If no cursor is sent, the first set of bank accounts will be returned.

200.description: Returns back a list of Bank Account objects.

data.description: A map with a data property that contains an array of bank accounts. Each entry in the array is a separate bank account object.

cursor.description: A cursor for use in pagination. This cursor is to be used in the next request's cursor parameter to request the next set of bank accounts.

get.description: Retrieves the details of an existing customer's bank account. Supply the unique customer id and unique bank account id for that customer from the customer list and bank account list respectively.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The id of the customer to return.

parameters.name: bank_account_id
parameters.description: The id of the bank account to return.

schema.description: A bank account object which contains information about the bank account.

account_number.description: The account number of the bank account.

account_type.description: The type of the bank account.

account_name.description: The name of the bank account.

end_date.description: The end date of the bank account in the format yyyy-MM-dd.

start_date.description: The start date of the bank account in the format yyyy-MM-dd.

guid.description: An identifier for the bank account submitted by the data provider.

post.description:
Inscribe's Collect API allows you to automate each step of your document collection process, from customer contact to fraud checks and verification.
In order to initiate a Collect Session, you will need to provide Inscribe with information about the user you wish to collect documents from, as well as the documents you need to collect from them. You will also need to provide your authentication details.

id.description: The unique identifier of the associated customer object. If an id is not provided, a name must be provided.

name.description: The name of the customer object that will be created and associated with the session. If an id is provided this field will be ignored. Note that customer object names are required to be unique.

email.description: The contact email of the user. This field is required if the value of send_email is True.

success_url.description: The URL the user will be redirected to when they complete the session. Any occurrence of the string "{SESSION_ID}" in the URL will be replaced with the session id.

cancel_url.description: The URL the user will be redirected to when they abort or cancel the session. Any occurrence of the string "{SESSION_ID}" in the URL will be replaced with the session id.

send_email.description: A boolean indicating whether Inscribe should email the user a URL for the Collect session (if send_email is True, the email field must not be null).

url.description: The URL for the session. The first UUID in the URL is a unique identifier for your organisation that will be static accross Collect sessions. The second UUID in the URL is the session id.

customer_id.description: Unique identifier for the associated customer.

created_at.description: Time at which the session was completed. In the format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ

completed_at.description: Time at which the session was completed. This will be null if the session has not been completed. In the format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ

success_url.description: The URL the user will be redirected to when they complete the session.

cancel_url.description: The URL the user will be redirected to when they abort or cancel the session.

logo_url.description: A link to the logo displayed in the collect session.

display_name.description: The name of the company being displayed in the collect session.

expired.description: States if the session is active

id.description: The unique identifier of the document request.

label.description: A descriptive string displayed when making the document request.

max_documents.description: The maximum number of accepted documents that the user can upload to this request. The maximum value is 70, the default and minimum value is 1. Requests which stipulate a value in excess of 70 will be silently capped at 70.

verify.description: A list of verification types that will be applied to documents uploaded to this request.

tags.description: A list of the user-defined document request tags.

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of collect sessions for your organization.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Indicate which page of the session list to return, the default is 1.

parameters.name: expired
parameters.description: Filter the returned collect sessions from the expired state. If omitted, both expired and active sessions will be returned.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: Filter the returned collect sessions by a given customer ID. If omitted, sessions for all customers will be returned.

data.description: A list of collect session objects.

limit.description: The limit on the number of collect sessions that can be returned per page.

number_of_pages.description: The total number of pages available with the current query parameters.

total.description: The total number of collect sessions available with the current query parameters.

404.description: The specified resource was not found.

get.description: Retrieve a collect session by UUID

parameters.name: session_id
parameters.description: The id of the collect session to return.

documents.description: A list containing the full Document Response for each document collected.

put.description: Edit properties of a collect session.

parameters.name: session_id
parameters.description: The id of the collect session to return.

expired.description: Set whether the collect session is expired or not. An expired session can be reactivated at any time.

post.description: Add a document request to a Collect Session

parameters.name: session_id
parameters.description: The id of the collect session to add the document request to.

label.description: A descriptive string displayed when making the document request.

description.description: An optional description of the document request that will be visible to the collect session user.
description.example: A personal bank statement for proof-of-income

max_documents.description: The maximum number of accepted documents that the user can upload to this request. The maximum value is 70, the default and minimum value is 1. Requests which stipulate a value in excess of 70 will be silently capped at 70.

200.description: Successfully created collect session document requests.

delete.description: Remove a collect session document request by its given UUID

parameters.name: session_id
parameters.description: The id of the collect session to remove the document request from.

parameters.name: document_request_id
parameters.description: The UUID of the document request to be removed. The id can be retrieved from the [Get a Collect Session](https://docs.inscribe.ai/reference/getcollectsession) response.

200.description: Successfully deleted collect session document request.

get.description: Returns income and creditworthiness information extracted from transactions belonging to a specific customer.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The id of the customer to return.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Specifies the start date for data retrieval. Only data with a date on or after this will be considered. This helps in filtering the data to a specific time frame of interest.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Specifies the end date for data retrieval. Only data with a date before this will be considered. This helps in filtering data to a specific time frame of interest.

parameters.name: document_ids
parameters.description: A comma separated list of document UUIDs. Only data from these documents will be considered (as well as open banking data). This helps in filtering data to include/exclude certain documents.

summary_statistics.description: Summary statistics that contain inferred creditworthiness and income information (based on the submitted customer documents and transactions).

credits_count.description: The quantity of credit transactions within the customer's transactions.

credits_total.description: Summed amounts of all credit transactions within the customer's transactions (in cents). (Also still accessible via the deprecated alias `credits_total_gross`.)

debits_count.description: The quantity of debit transactions within the customer's transactions.

debits_total.description: Summed amounts of all debit transactions within the customer's transactions (in cents). (Also still accessible via the deprecated alias `debits_total_gross`.)

maximum_consecutive_days.description: The longest sequence of consecutive days that the uploaded customer data covers.

personal_income_annual_gross.description: The estimated gross annual personal income for the customer inferred from submitted payslips (in cents). (Also still accessible via the deprecated alias `salary_annual_gross`.)

personal_income_annual_net.description: The estimated net annual personal income for the customer inferred from their transactions and/or payslips (in cents). (Also still accessible via the deprecated alias `salary_annual_net`.)

personal_income_period_gross.description: The total gross summed personal income found within the customer's submitted payslips (in cents). The term `period` refers to the time interval covering the earliest date to the latest date found in the submitted data. (Also still accessible via the deprecated alias `salary_period_gross`.)

personal_income_period_net.description: The total net summed personal income found within the customer's transactions and/or payslips (in cents). The term `period` refers to the time interval covering the earliest date to the latest date found in the submitted data. (Also still accessible via the deprecated alias `salary_period_net`.)

revenue_annual_gross.description: The estimated gross annual revenue for the customer inferred from their transactions (in cents).

revenue_period_gross.description: The total gross summed revenue found within the customer's transactions (in cents). The term `period` refers to the time interval covering the earliest date to the latest date found in the submitted data.

total_net.description: The summed debit amounts minus the summed credit amounts (in cents).

transfers_count.description: The quantity of transfer transactions within the customer's transactions.

transfers_credits_total.description: Summed amounts of all credit transfer transactions within the customer's transactions (in cents). (Also still accessible via the deprecated alias `transfers_credits_total_gross`.)

transfers_debits_total.description: Summed amounts of all debit transfer transactions within the customer's transactions (in cents). (Also still accessible via the deprecated alias `transfers_debits_total_gross`.)

unique_days_count.description: Number of distinct days covered by the customer's bank statements and transactions.

bank_accounts.description: A list of bank accounts associated with the customer.

items.description: The respective UUID for the bank account.

metadata.description: Additional data which provides context about Inscribe's Credit Insights response.

confidence_score.description: The confidence score represents the degree of certainty for the accuracy of the Credit Insights outputs.  We calculate this score using a weighted combination of parsing and transaction categorization certainties.  Confidence scores above 0.5 represent high confidence.

customer_contains_low_trust_documents.description: This value will be set to True if the customer contains any documents under a trust score threshold of 50. Else,  this will be set to False.

included_data_sources.description: Lists all documents and open banking data which were used to create the Inscribe Credit Insights.

excluded_data_sources.description: Lists all documents and open banking data which were excluded from the Inscribe Credit Insights. Documents can be excluded if they are duplicate documents, or when the include_unreconciled_documents query parameter is set to False.

query_parameters.description: Lists the query parameters which were used in the original endpoint request.

confidence_score.description: The confidence score represents the degree of certainty for the accuracy of the Credit Insights outputs.  We calculate this score using a weighted combination of parsing and transaction categorization certainties.  Confidence scores above 0.5 represent high confidence. Also accessible under the `metadata` header.

customer_contains_low_trust_documents.description: This value will be set to True if the customer contains any documents under a trust score threshold of 50. Else,  this will be set to False. Also accessible under the `metadata` header.

parameters.name: customer_id

parameters.name: bank_account_id

personal_income_annual_net.description: The estimated net annual personal income inferred from the bank account's transactions (in cents). (Also still accessible via the deprecated alias `salary_annual_net`.)

personal_income_period_net.description: The total net summed personal_income found within the bank account's transactions (in cents).  The term `period` refers to the time interval covering the earliest date to the latest date found in the submitted data. (Also still accessible via the deprecated alias `salary_period_net`.)

revenue_annual_gross.description: The estimated gross annual revenue inferred from the bank account's transactions (in cents).

revenue_period_gross.description: The total gross summed revenue found within the bank account's transactions (in cents).  The term `period` refers to the time interval covering the earliest date to the latest date found in the submitted data.

total_net.description: The summed debit amounts minus the summed credit amounts (in cents).

transfers_count.description: The quantity of transfer transactions within the bank account's transactions.

transfers_credits_total.description: Summed amounts of all credit transfer transactions within the bank account's transactions (in cents). (Also still accessible via the deprecated alias `transfers_credits_total_gross`.)

transfers_debits_total.description: Summed amounts of all debit transfer transactions within the bank account's transactions (in cents). (Also still accessible via the deprecated alias `transfers_debits_total_gross`.)

unique_days_count.description: Number of distinct days covered by the bank account statements and transactions.

confidence_score.description: The confidence score represents the degree of certainty for the accuracy of the Credit Insights outputs.  We calculate this score using a weighted combination of parsing and transaction categorization certainties.  Confidence scores above 0.5 represent high confidence.

customer_contains_low_trust_documents.description: This value will be set to True if the customer contains any documents under a trust score threshold of 50. Else,  this will be set to False.

get.description: Returns cashflow and balance insights derived from submitted customer documents and transactions.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The id of the customer to return.

schema.description: Insights about cashflow and balances (aggregated at both the customer and bank account levels).

average_credit_amount.description: The average transaction amount across all credit transactions (in cents).

average_debit_amount.description: The average transaction amount across all debit transactions (in cents).

count_credit_transactions.description: The count of all credit transactions.

count_debit_transactions.description: The count of all debit transactions.

total_credits.description: The summed amount of all credit transactions (in cents).

total_debits.description: The summed amount of all debit transactions (in cents).

total_net.description: This is equivalent to total_credits minus total_debits.

count_self_transfers.description: The quantity of self-transfers. We define a self-transfer as a bank transfer between separate bank accounts within the same entity (e.g. an individual transferring money from their checking to their savings account).

max_balance.description: The highest aggregated daily balance found (in cents). Daily balances are taken from the end of each day. This aggregated statistic refers to the overall customer daily balance (i.e. the sum across all customer bank accounts).

min_balance.description: The lowest aggregated daily balance found (in cents). Daily balances are taken from the end of each day. This aggregated statistic refers to the overall customer daily balance (i.e. the sum across all customer bank accounts).

beginning_balance.description: The beginning balance found in the period (in cents). Daily balances are taken from the end of each day. This aggregated statistic refers to the overall customer daily balance (i.e. the sum across all customer bank accounts).

ending_balance.description: The ending balance found in the period (in cents). Daily balances are taken from the end of each day. This aggregated statistic refers to the overall customer daily balance (i.e. the sum across all customer bank accounts).

count_negative_balance_days.description: The number of days for which there was a negative balance. Daily balances are taken from the end of each day. This aggregated statistic refers to the overall customer daily balance (i.e. the sum across all customer bank accounts).

average_daily_balance.description: The statistical mean of the daily balances across the time period. Daily balances are taken from the end of each day. This aggregated statistic refers to the overall customer daily balance (i.e. the sum across all customer bank accounts).

daily_balance_volatility.description: This is the [standard deviation](<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Standard_deviation>) of all daily balances. This represents the volatility of the customers bank account balances. For customers with multiple bank accounts, we calculate the [standard deviation of the sum ](<https://online.stat.psu.edu/stat500/book/export/html/572>)of the bank account balance variables.

cashflow_by_category.description: Cashflow insights specific to each transaction category.

cashflow_by_method.description: Cashflow insights specific to each transaction method. Transaction methods describes 'how' a transaction was completed (e.g. cash, check, bank transfer).

total_credits.description: The summed amount of all credit transactions relevant to this transaction method (in cents).

total_debits.description: The summed amount of all debit transactions relevant to this transaction method (in cents).

total_net.description: This is equivalent to total_credits minus total_debits.

total_credits.description: The summed amount of all credit transactions relevant to this transaction method (in cents).

total_debits.description: The summed amount of all debit transactions relevant to this transaction method (in cents).

total_net.description: This is equivalent to total_credits minus total_debits.

total_credits.description: The summed amount of all credit transactions relevant to this transaction method (in cents).

total_debits.description: The summed amount of all debit transactions relevant to this transaction method (in cents).

total_net.description: This is equivalent to total_credits minus total_debits.

total_credits.description: The summed amount of all credit transactions relevant to this transaction method (in cents).

total_debits.description: The summed amount of all debit transactions relevant to this transaction method (in cents).

total_net.description: This is equivalent to total_credits minus total_debits.

bank_accounts.description: A list of bank accounts associated with the customer.

confidence_score.description: The confidence score represents the degree of certainty for the accuracy of the Credit Insights outputs. We calculate this score using a weighted combination of parsing and transaction categorization certainties. Confidence scores above 0.5 represent high confidence.

get.description: Returns loan insights derived from submitted customer documents and transactions.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The id of the customer to return.

count_loan_repayments.description: The quantity of loan repayment transactions.

total_loan_repayments.description: The summed amount of all loan repayment transactions (in cents).

count_loan_disbursements.description: The quantity of loan disbursement (income) transactions.

total_loan_disbursements.description: The summed amount of all loan disbursement (income) transactions (in cents).

loans.description: All found loans, split by lender. Each lender has an array of loans, as there may be more than one loan per lender (e.g. a customer may have a car loan and a mortgage with the same lender).

repayment_transaction_ids.description: An array of all loan repayment transaction ids for the given loan.

disbursement_transaction_ids.description: An array of all loan disbursement transaction ids for the given loan.

repayment_frequency.description: The frequency of this loan repayment, either `daily`, `weekly`, `fortnightly`, `monthly`, `irregular`, or `unknown`.

first_seen.description: The earliest date that a repayment transaction was seen for this loan.

total_repayments.description: The summed total of all loan repayment transactions for this loan (in cents).

total_disbursements.description: The summed total of all loan disbursement (income) transactions for this loan (in cents).

category.description: The Inscribe loan category that this loan belongs to. Options here include the top-level category `loan`, or the subcategories `mortgage`, `card_repayment`, `mca`, `payday`, `auto_loan`, or `buy_now_pay_later`.

confidence_score.description: The confidence score represents the degree of certainty for the accuracy of the Credit Insights outputs.  We calculate this score using a weighted combination of parsing and transaction categorization certainties.  Confidence scores above 0.5 represent high confidence.

get.description: Returns risk insights derived from submitted customer documents and transactions.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The id of the customer to return.

schema.description: Insights about risk specific to the listed customer or bank account.

count_atm_withdrawal.description: The quantity of ATM withdrawal transactions.

total_atm_withdrawal.description: The summed amount of all ATM withdrawal transactions (in cents).

count_nsf.description: The quantity of non-sufficient fund transactions. Excluding refund transactions.

count_nsf_days.description: The number of unique days on which non-sufficient fund transactions occurred. Excluding refund transactions.

count_overdraft.description: The quantity of overdraft transactions. Excluding refund transactions.

count_overdraft_days.description: The number of unique days on which overdraft transactions occurred. Excluding refund transactions.

gambling_net.description: This is the total gambling income minus the total gambling losses (in cents).

total_gambling_spend.description: The summed amount of all gambling spend transactions (in cents).

expenditure_exceeds_income.description: A boolean which checks if total expenditure exceeded total income. For example, this will be set to True if total expenditure is $100 and total income is $50.

large_deposits.description: The quantity of large deposits that exceed defined thresholds.

threshold_amount.description: The static threshold_amount determines if a deposit is significantly large or not. e.g., If 100000 is returned in this key, then the number of deposits over $1000.00 (100000 cents) will be returned in the quantity field

threshold_monthly_income_percentage.description: The percentage threshold determines if a deposit is significantly large or not based on an income percentage. e.g., If 50 is returned in this key, then the number of deposits which amount to over 50% of monthly income will be returned in the quantity field

quantity.description:
The number of deposits whose amount exceeds the defined thresholds. For example, let's imagine deposit amounts of [1000, 200000, 12000000, 21000000] (in cents) and a predicted monthly income of 150000.

If: threshold_amount = 1000000 Then: quantity = 2 (There are only 2 deposits whose amount is greater than 1000000 cents)

If: threshold_monthly_income_percentage: 50 (50% of total monthly income, which is 50% of 150000 = 75000) Then: quantity = 3 (There are 3 deposits whose amount is greater than 50% of monthly income  (75000))

large_withdrawals.description: The quantity of large withdrawals based on defined thresholds.

threshold_amount.description: The static threshold_amount determines if a withdrawal is significantly large or not. e.g., If 100000 is returned in this key, then the number of withdrawals over $1000.00 (100000 cents) will be returned in the quantity field

quantity.description: The number of withdrawals whose amounts exceed the threshold given by the threshold_amount field

count_crypto_trading.description: The quantity of crypto trading transactions.

crypto_trading_net.description: The summed amount of all crypto trading transactions (in cents).

count_negative_balance_days.description: The number of days for which there was a negative balance. Daily balances are taken from the end of each day.

daily_balance_volatility.description: This is the [standard deviation](<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Standard_deviation>) of all daily balances. This represents the volatility of the customers bank account balances. For customers with multiple bank accounts, we calculate the [standard deviation of the sum ](<https://online.stat.psu.edu/stat500/book/export/html/572>)of the bank account balance variables.

confidence_score.description: The confidence score represents the degree of certainty for the accuracy of the Credit Insights outputs. We calculate this score using a weighted combination of parsing and transaction categorization certainties. Confidence scores above 0.5 represent high confidence.

fraud_rating.description: The fraud rating of the customer. This field can be either 'HIGH_RISK', 'LOW_RISK', 'UNCERTAIN_RISK', or null. More information can be found at https://help.inscribe.ai/en/articles/8631969-fraud-rating

verify_entity.description: Entities that have been requested to be verified.

income.description: Income entities that have requested to be verified. This service is currently only available for Inscribe Credit customers. The `personal_income` and `revenue` fields will only be returned if they were included in the initial verification request when creating the customer.

personal_income.description: This is the personal income verification request.

lower_income_tolerance.description: The tolerance with which found incomes below the `input` amount are verified. For example, if this value is set to 0.1, an income will verified if it is at least 90% (1-`lower_income_tolerance`) of the `input` amount.

under_reported_tolerance.description: The tolerance with which found incomes above the `input` amount are set to `under_reported`. For example, if this value is set to 0.1, an income will set to `under_reported` if it is at least 110% (1+`under_reported_tolerance`) of the `input` amount.

input.description: This is the expected income amount to be verified (in cents).

frequency.description: This is frequency of the income to check. Currently, the only income that can be checked is `annual` income.

verified.description: This is the status of the verification request. This will be set to `true` if the found income was greater than or equal to the `input` value (adjusted by any given `lower_income_tolerance`). It will be set to `false` if the `input` value did not meet that threshold. If no relevant documents have been provided, this value is set to `null`.

matched.description: This is the found income amount (in cents).

amount_type.description: This is the type of the found income.

under_reported.description: This value is set to `true` if the found income exceeded the `input` amount. It is set to `false` if the found income did not. It is set to `null` if no relevant documents were provided or if the income was not verified.

revenue.description: This is the revenue verification request.

lower_income_tolerance.description: The tolerance with which found incomes below the `input` amount are verified. For example, if this value is set to 0.1, an income will verified if it is at least 90% (1-`lower_income_tolerance`) of the `input` amount.

under_reported_tolerance.description: The tolerance with which found incomes above the `input` amount are set to `under_reported`. For example, if this value is set to 0.1, an income will set to `under_reported` if it is at least 110% (1+`under_reported_tolerance`) of the `input` amount.

frequency.description: This is frequency of the revenue to check. Currently, the only revenue that can be checked is `annual` income.

verified.description: This is the status of the verification request. This will be set to `true` if the found revenue was greater than or equal to the `input` value (adjusted by any given `lower_income_tolerance`). It will be set to `false` if the `input` value did not meet that threshold. If no relevant documents have been provided, this value is set to `null`.

matched.description: This is the found revenue amount (in cents).

amount_type.description: This is the type of the found revenue.

under_reported.description: This value is set to `true` if the found revenue exceeded the `input` amount. It is set to `false` if the found revenue did not. It is set to `null` if no relevant documents were provided or if the revenue was not verified.

confidence_score.description: The confidence score represents the degree of certainty for the income verification decision.  We calculate this score using a weighted combination of parsing and transaction categorization certainties.  Confidence scores above 0.5 represent high confidence.

get.description: Returns a paginated list of your customers based on optional query parameters. If the customer search query parameter is used, the list is sorted by relevance, otherwise, the customers are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created customers appearing first.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Set a limit on the number of customers to be returned. The limit can range between 1 and 100, the default is 10.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Indicate which page of the customer list to return, the default is 1.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Filter by a customer's name. Any order parameters will be ignored and results will be ordered by similarity to the search term.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by the customer's status. This parameter can accept multiple values, allowing for a combination of status filters. Separate each status with a comma. The available filter options are: 'approved', 'rejected', and 'unknown', which reflect the customer approved field set by you as true, false, and null respectively. For example, '?status=approved,rejected' will filter customers whose status is either 'approved' or 'rejected'.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Option to order the list of customers. There are two options: 'created_at' and '-created_at' where customers are returned sorted by creation date in ascending or descending order respectively.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The date filter allows you to filter customers by date intervals. The value must be in the format yyyy-MM-dd or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ for precise filtering. The filter includes everything from the start date up to but not including the end date. startDate and endDate must both be set to filter by date.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The date filter allows you to filter customers by date intervals. The value must be in the format yyyy-MM-dd or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ for precise filtering. The filter includes everything from the start date up to but not including the end date. endDate and startDate must both be set to filter by date.

parameters.name: creator
parameters.description: Filter customers created only by this user id. This user must be in your organisation and you must have permission to access their customers.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Filter customers where at least one document has been marked with the descriptive tag supplied.

parameters.name: customer_ids
parameters.description: A comma separated list of customer UUIDs. This will filter the customers to only include the ones with the given UUIDs.

code-samples.code:
curl "https://api.inscribe.ai/api/v2/customers/{customer_id}/documents/" \
-H "Authorization: Inscribe ..." \
-F 'fileX=@/path/to/fileX' \
-F 'fileY=@/path/to/fileY' \
-F 'verify_entities=[{"name":"Jane Customer", "address":"1000 Walnut Kansas City MO"}]' \
-F 'tags=[{"text": "onboarding"}, {"text": "new_system"}]'

import requests
import os
import json

customer_id = "CUSTOMER_ID"

url = f"https://api.inscribe.ai/api/v2/customers/{customer_id}/documents"

headers = {
    "Authorization": "Inscribe ..."
}

verify_entities = [{
    "name": "Jane Customer",
    "address": "1000 Walnut Kansas City MO",
    "company": "Smith & Sons",
    "id_number": "92914567",
    "strings": [{"key": "phone", "input": "929-7113-145"}]
}]

tags = [{"text": "onboarding"}, {"text": "new_customer"}]

with open("DOCUMENT_FILE_PATH", "rb+") as document:
    filename = os.path.basename(document.name)
    files = {
        "verify_entities": (None, json.dumps(verify_entities), 'application/json'),
        "tags": (None, json.dumps(tags), 'application/json'),
        "file": (filename, document, "application/octet-stream")
    }
    response = requests.request("POST", url, files=files, headers=headers)
    print(response.text)

post.description: Uploads document(s) to a customer. Once the document(s) are uploaded, they will be queued for processing by Inscribe's fraud detection, parsing, and optionally verification algorithms. The file size limit is 50 MB and the page limit for PDFs is 350.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Inscribe customer id.

requestBody.description: The document(s) you would like to upload. These document(s) must be one of the following supported mime type: application/pdf, image/jpg, image/png, application/octet-stream.

files.description: A list of files to be uploaded for analysis.

verify_entities.description: Each verify_entity object in this array corresponds to a file in the above "files" parameter.

items.description: Optional information to be verified against a document. If supplied there must be exactly one entry for each document, an entry can be blank if no information is to be verified.

name.description: A personal name you wish to verify against the document. **Warning** This field is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use `names` instead.

names.description: An array of personal names you wish to verify against the document.

items.description: A personal name you wish to verify against the document.

address.description: An address you wish to verify is represented in the document. **Warning** This field is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use `addresses` instead.

addresses.description: An array of address you wish to verify are represented in the document.

items.description: An address you wish to verify is represented in the document.

company.description: A company name you wish to verify against the document. **Warning** This field is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use `companies` instead.

companies.description: An array of company names you wish to verify against the document.

items.description: A company name you wish to verify against the document.

id_number.description: An identification number you wish to verify against the document. Currently, SSN and EIN formats are supported. **Warning** This field is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use `id_numbers` instead.

id_numbers.description: An array of identification numbers you wish to verify against the document.

items.description: An identification number you wish to verify against the document. Currently, SSN and EIN formats are supported.

key.description: An identifier for the input. Set by you for your own reference.

input.description: A string you wish to verify against the document.

key.description: An identifier for the pattern. Set by you for your own reference.

pattern.description: A regular expression pattern you wish to verify against the document.

tags.description: These tags will be associated with all the uploaded document(s).

text.description: A descriptive value chosen by you to group documents together across customers.

data.description: A map with a data property that contains an array of documents that have been uploaded. Each entry in the array is a separate document object.

get.description: Returns a list of all of your documents for a customer. The list is sorted by creation date, with the most recently created documents appearing first.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Inscribe customer id.

parameters.name: customer_ids
parameters.description: A comma separated list of customer UUIDs. Filter documents by specific customer IDs.

parameters.name: customer_statuses
parameters.description: Filter documents by customer status.

parameters.name: document_ids
parameters.description: A comma separated list of document UUIDs. Filter documents by specific document IDs.

parameters.name: document_types
parameters.description: Filter documents by document type

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Filter documents created before this date.

parameters.name: file_types
parameters.description: Filter documents by file type.

parameters.name: is_fraudulent
parameters.description: Filter documents by fraud status.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Set a limit on the number of documents to be returned per page. The limit can range between 1 and 50, the default is 15.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sort order for documents. Use -created_at for descending order by creation date.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Indicate which page of the document list to return, the default is 1.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search query to filter documents.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Filter documents created on or after this date.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: A comma separated list of tags. Filter documents by tag.

200.description: Returns back a list of Document objects.

data.description: A map with a data property that contains an array of documents that have been uploaded. Each entry in the array is a separate document object.

limit.description: The limit on the number of documents that can be returned. per page.

number_of_pages.description: The total number of pages available with the current query parameters.

total.description: The total number of documents available with the current query parameters.

fraudulent_count.description: The number of fraudulent documents in this customer.

get.description: Retrieve results and information of an existing document. Supply the unique customer id from either a customer creation request or the customer list, and the document id from either a document upload request or a list of documents from the customer. Inscribe will return the corresponding document overview when the document is in the PROCESSED state, until then some information will be unavailable. A webhook can be configured to receive PROCESSED document results in real-time.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The Inscribe customer id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the document for which you want to retrieve results.

uuid.description: Unique uuid identifier for the object.

id.description: Unique integer identifier for the object.

name.description: The filename of the document.

created_at.description: Time at which the object was created. In the format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ

customer_id.description: The UUID of the associated Customer object

customer_name.description: The name of the associated Customer object

state.description: The current state of the document, it has the following options: PROCESSING - This document is still being processed. PROCESSED - This document has finished processing and results are available. ERROR_PROCESSING - An error occurred while processing this document. VIRUS_DETECTED - This document was found to contain a virus and will not be processed. CORRUPT_DATA_DETECTED - This document was found to contain corrupted data and could not be processed. PASSWORD_PROTECTED - This document is password protected. EXCEEDS_MAX_PAGE_COUNT - This document exceeds the maximum page count of 350.

total_pages.description: The number of pages in the document. This value will be null until the document is in the PROCESSED state.

document_type.description: The document type identified by Inscribe's classifier. This value will be null until the document is in the PROCESSED state.

subtypes.description:
A list of the document subtypes identified by Inscribe's classifier. Currently, subtypes are identified for "TAX_FORM" and "BANK_STATEMENT" document types.
Tax documents can have the subtypes: "CP_575", "147C", "SS4", "W2", "W3", "FORM_1040", "FORM_1040_SCHEDULE_C", "FORM_1065", "FORM_1099_MISC", "FORM_1099_NEC", "FORM_1120", "FORM_1120_S".
The full list of subtypes for bank statements can be found at https://docs.inscribe.ai/docs/documents-classified-by-bank-names.

file_type.description: The file type identified by Inscribe. This value will be null until the document is in the PROCESSED state.

language.description: The document language. More information on the available options can be found at https://docs.inscribe.ai/docs/language-field

is_fraudulent.description: Has the value true if Inscribes fraud detection algorithms have identified the document as being fraudulent, false if sufficient evidence of fraud is not found in the document. This value is only available when the document is in the PROCESSED state.

trust_score.description: The trust score of a document, between 0 and 100. More information can be found at https://help.inscribe.ai/en/articles/5557654-trust-score.

quality_score.description: The quality score of a document, between 0 and 100. More information can be found at https://help.inscribe.ai/en/articles/5567690-quality-score.

review_status.description: The current status of document level feedback. More information can be found at https://help.inscribe.ai/en/articles/8523290-document-level-feedback.

web_app.description: A URL to the location of this document on our web app.

api.description: A URL to the location of this document on our API.

original_file.description: A URL to the location of the original document uploaded to us.

tags.description: A list of tags that you have assigned to a document. Tags are used to group documents together across customers.

value.description: A descriptive string chosen by you to group documents together across customers.

collect_session.description: An optional object, this will be non-null if this document was uploaded as part of a Collect session.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Collect session.

document_request_id.description: Unique identifier for the document request that this document document was uploaded to.

created_at.description: Time at which the session was created. In the format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ

completed_at.description: Time at which the session was completed. This will be null if the session has not been completed. In the format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ

checks.description: A list of checks that were applied to the document. This feature is in beta and will improve over time.

name.description: The name of the check

public.description: Whether the check is shown to customers during collect sessions

passed.description: Whether the check passed all of its conditions

triggers.description: A list of trigger conditions that were satisfied, causing the check to be applied to the document

name.description: The name of the condition variable

requirements.description: A list of requirement conditions applied to the document

name.description: The name of the condition variable

actual_value.description: The value of the condition variable

passed.description: Whether the requirement condition was met or not

name.description: The name key will only exist if a name was submitted to be verified against this document. The values within will only be available when the document is in the PROCESSED state. **Warning** This field is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use `names` instead.

verified.description: Indicates if the name submitted was verified to be in the document. This value is only available when the document is in the PROCESSED state.

pattern.description: The pattern submitted to be verified in the document. This value is only available when the document is in the PROCESSED state.

matched_string.description: The first string found in the document that matches the submitted pattern. This value is only available when the document is in the PROCESSED state.

matched_groups.description: The strings found in the document that matched the capturing groups in the submitted pattern. If the pattern contained no capturing groups then this will be an empty array. This value is only available when the document is in the PROCESSED state.

error.description: A description of the error that occurred. This value is only available when the document is in the PROCESSED state and an error occurred.

parsed_details.description: Relevant information that has been parsed from the document you supplied. Note: this currently only works on English language documents.

document_date.description: The document date. For documents such as bank statements, this will be the last day of the statement period. For utility bills and invoices, this will be the date of issue of the bill or invoice. For payslips, this will be the check date or advice date. The document_date key will not exist if a date could not be parsed from the document and values within will only be available when the document is in the PROCESSED state. This feature is in beta and will improve over time.

raw.description: The raw date as it appears in the document. This value is only available when the document is in the PROCESSED state.

normalized.description: Normalized date. In the format yyyy-MM-dd - example: 2019-12-03. If a day is not present in the raw date, the normalized date will correspond to the last day of the month. For example, February 2019 will be normalized as 2019-02-28. This value is only available when the document is in the PROCESSED state.

confidence.description: A value between 0 and 1 indicating the confidence in the parsed output. This value is only available when the document is in the PROCESSED state.

address.description: The address of the document recipient. The address key will not exist if an address could not be parsed from the document and values within will only be available when the document is in the PROCESSED state. This feature is in beta and will improve over time.

normalized.description: Normalized address. This value is only available when the document is in the PROCESSED state.
normalized.example: 1000 Walnut St, Kansas City, MO 64106, USA

structured.description: The structured output of the address. Any or all of these fields can be empty depending on the raw address.

name.description: The relevant name that this document references. The name key will not exist if a name could not be parsed from the document and values within will only be available when the document is in the PROCESSED state. This feature is in beta and will improve over time.

raw.description: The name of the document recipient. This feature is in beta and will improve over time. This value is only available when the document is in the PROCESSED state.

variants.description: List of name variants for matching against, obtained by formatting by line and removing titles and incorporation suffixes. For example, the raw name "MR FRANK ABAGNALE\nHOT DEALS LLC" will have as a list of variants ["Mr Frank Abagnale", "Frank Abagnale" "Hot Deals Llc", "Hot Deals"]. This value is only available when the document is in the PROCESSED state.

confidence.description: A value between 0 and 1 indicating the confidence in the parsed output. This value is only available when the document is in the PROCESSED state.

account_number.description: The account_number key contains information about the account number as presented in relevant documents such as bank statements or utility bills. The account_number key will not exist if an account number could not be parsed from the document and values within will only be available when the document is in the PROCESSED state. This feature is in beta and will improve over time.

raw.description: The account number as it appears on the document. This feature is in beta and will improve over time. This value is only available when the document is in the PROCESSED state.

normalized.description: A formatted version of the account number, with all spaces removed. This value is only available when the document is in the PROCESSED state.

confidence.description: A value between 0 and 1 indicating the confidence in the parsed output. This value is only available when the document is in the PROCESSED state.

normalized.description: The numeric part of the balance, with currency information removed. This value is only available when the document is in the PROCESSED state.

confidence.description: A value between 0 and 1 indicating the confidence in the parsed output. This value is only available when the document is in the PROCESSED state.

bank_accounts.description: An array of parsed bank accounts found in the document and the parsed details associated with each account. If no bank accounts are found, an empty array is returned. If the document is not of type `BANK_STATEMENT`, the key will not be present in the response.

institution_name.description: The name of the bank which issued the document, see documentation for supported banks [here](https://docs.inscribe.ai/docs/documents-classified-by-bank-names).

account_type.description: The bank account type identified by Inscribe. This can have one of the following values: `"BUSINESS"`, `"PERSONAL"`. The value will be `null` if no account type was identified.

name.description: An object providing information about the name of the bank account as it appears on the bank statement. This is distinct from the name of the document owner, which is available as a top-level key within the `"parsed_details"` object. An empty object is returned if a matching result has not been found.

raw.description: The name of the bank account as it appears on the bank statement.

normalized.description: A normalized form of the name.

confidence.description: A number between 0 and 1 giving the confidence associated with this result.

number.description: An object providing information about the bank account number as it appears on the document. An empty object is returned if a matching result has not been found.

raw.description: The number of the bank account as it appears on the bank statement.

normalized.description: A normalized form of the number.

confidence.description: A number between 0 and 1 giving the confidence associated with this result.

beginning_date.description: An object providing information about the beginning date of activity associated with bank account. An empty object is returned if a matching result has not been found.

raw.description: The beginning date as it appears on the bank statement.

normalized.description: ISO 8601 formatted date string.

confidence.description: A number between 0 and 1 giving the confidence associated with this result.

ending_date.description: An object providing information about the ending date of activity associated with bank account. An empty object is returned if a matching result has not been found.

raw.description: The ending date as it appears on the bank statement.

normalized.description: ISO 8601 formatted date string.

confidence.description: A number between 0 and 1 giving the confidence associated with this result.

beginning_balance.description: An object providing information about the beginning balance of the bank account. An empty object is returned if a matching result has not been found.

raw.description: The beginning balance as it appears on the bank statement.

normalized.description: A signed integer giving the beginning balance in cents.

confidence.description: A number between 0 and 1 giving the confidence associated with this result.

ending_balance.description: An object providing information about the ending balance of the bank account. An empty object is returned if a matching result has not been found.

raw.description: The ending balance as it appears on the bank statement.

normalized.description: A signed integer giving the ending balance in cents.

confidence.description: A number between 0 and 1 giving the confidence associated with this result.

transactions_match_balances.description: Indicates if the sum of the beginning balance and transaction total are equal to the ending balance if a beginning and ending balance are present for the account. Otherwise, returns `null`.

transactions.description: An array of the transactions found to be associated with this account. Transaction parsing must be enabled by Inscribe for your account before the results are available, otherwise the key will be omitted from the response. You can contact Inscribe via intercom to enquire about enabling the service. If the service is not enabled for your account, the key will be omitted from the response.

id.description: A unique identifier for each transaction.

date.description: The date of the transaction in the form `YYYY-MM-DD`.

description.description: The description of the transaction as it appears on the statement.
description.example: Ssa Treas 310 Des:Xxsoc Sec Id:Xxxxxxxxxa Ssa Indn:Randall J Wright Co Id:9031036360 Ppd

amount.description: A signed integer giving the transaction amount in cents. Negative values indicate debits, positive values indicate credits.

transaction_confidence.description: A number between 0 and 1 giving the document-level confidence of the transactions returned in the `"transactions"` section. The value will be `null` if no transactions were found for the account.

transaction_analysis.description: **Beta:** Relevant information that has been extracted from the parsed transactions associated with the bank account. Transaction analysis must be enabled by Inscribe for your account before the results are available, otherwise the key will be omitted from the response. You can contact Inscribe via intercom to enquire about enabling the service. This feature is in beta and will improve over time.

charges.description: Detected charges found within the bank account parsed transactions. Non-sufficent fund and overdraft charges are supported currently.

non_sufficient_funds.description: A list of non-sufficient fund charges detected from the bank account parsed transactions. If no charges are found, an empty array is returned.

transaction_id.description: The ID of the non-sufficient fund parsed transaction.

refunded.description: An indication of whether or not the charge was refunded.

refund_transaction_id.description: If a charge refund was issued, the ID of the transaction containing the refund. Otherwise returns `null`.

overdrafts.description: A list of overdraft charges detected from the bank account parsed transactions. If no charges are found, an empty array is returned.

transaction_id.description: The ID of the overdraft charge parsed transaction.

refunded.description: An indication of whether or not the overdraft charge was refunded.

refunded_transaction_id.description: If a charge refund was issued, the ID of the transaction containing the refund. Otherwise returns `null`.

summary_statistics.description: Credit analysis signals calculated from parsed document transactions during time period starting on date of beginning balance to the last date of month of the last transaction.

credits_count.description: Number of credits found in parsed transactions.

credits_total_gross.description: Sum of credits found in parsed transactions in cents.

debits_count.description: Number of debits found in parsed transactions.

debits_total_gross.description: Sum of debits found in parsed transactions in cents.

maximum_minus_minimum_balance.description: Difference between the maximum and minimum daily balances in cents, calculated by `maximum_balance - minimum_balance`

number_of_days_with_negative_balance.description: Number of days when account balance is negative.

revenue_annual.description: Estimated annual revenue, based on `revenue_for_period` and the time period of the bank statement.

revenue_for_period.description: Sum of all revenue transactions found within the bank statement.

salary_annual.description: Estimated annual salary, based on `salary_for_period` and the time period of the bank statement.

salary_for_period.description: Sum of all salary transactions found within the bank statement.

total_net.description: Sum of transactions in cents, calculated by `credits_total_gross - debits_total_gross`. In statements where `beginning_balance` and `ending_balance` are found for the bank account, `total_net` should equal `ending_balance - beginning_balance`.

transfers_credits_total_gross.description: Sum of credit transfers found in parsed transactions in cents.

transfers_debits_total_gross.description: Sum of debit transfers found in parsed transactions in cents.

transfers_total_net.description: Sum of transfer transactions in cents, transfers_credits_total_gross - transfers_debits_total_gross.

lending_activity.description: Detected loan payment and repayment transactions with identified lenders made to and from the customer respectively.

payments.description: List of all loan payment transactions made to the customer from a lender

transaction_id.description: The ID of the associated loan payment transaction.

lender.description: The name of the lender associated with the loan payment

repayments.description: List of all loan repayment transactions made by the customer to a lender

transaction_id.description: The ID of the associated loan repayment transaction.

lender.description: The name of the lender associated with the loan repayment

payslips.description: An array of parsed payslips found in the document and the parsed details associated with the payslips. If no payslips are found, an empty array is returned. If the document is not of type `PAYSLIP`, the key will not be present in the response. Payslip parsing must be enabled by Inscribe for your account before the results are available, otherwise the key will be omitted from the response. You can contact Inscribe via intercom to enquire about enabling the service. If the service is not enabled for your account, the key will be omitted from the response.

company.description: If the name parsed from a document is the name of a registered company, we will attempt to gather information about this entity using external databases. The company key will not exist if the name parsed from a document is not the name of a registered company, and values within will only be available when the document is in the PROCESSED state. This feature is in beta and will improve over time.

name.description: The name of the company as it appears on the external registry. This feature is in beta and will improve over time.

current_status.description: The current status of the company as it appears on the external registry. The range of possible statuses and the meaning of a given status are dependent on the external registry used.

retrieved_at.description: Time at which the information was extracted from the external registry. In the format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ.

opencorporates_url.description: A URL to the company's page on Opencorporates.

registry_url.description: A URL to the company's page on the relevant external registry.

device_fingerprint.description: An optional object that provides details on how and where a document was uploaded. This can be enabled either through Collect or through an API integration. See [here](https://docs.inscribe.ai/docs/device-identification) for more details.

visitor_id.description: Unique identifier for the device used to upload the document.

incognito_mode_used.description: Was the device's browser using enhanced privacy features when uploading the document. For example, Incognito on Chrome, Private Window on Safari, Private Browsing on Firefox, or InPrivate on Edge.

ip_address.description: The IP address used to upload the document.

ip_location.description: Location associated with the IP address used to upload the document.

city.description: The city the location is contained within. This value will be `null` if the location associated with the IP address is not contained within a city.

name.description: The city name.
The subdivision name.

country.description: The country the location is contained within.

name.description: The country name.

continent.description: The continent the location is contained within.

name.description: The continent name.

timezone.description: The timezone the location is contained within.

postal_code.description: The postal code associated with the location. The value will be `null` if there is no postal code associated with the location.

accuracy_radius.description: The accuracy radius in kilometers of the location associated with the IP address.

device_details.description: Details about the device and browser used to upload the document.

browser_name.description: The name of the browser used.

browser_major_version.description: The major version of the browser.

browser_full_version.description: The full version of the browser.

user_agent.example: Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 12; SM-G991U1) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/106.0.0.0 Mobile Safari/537.36

post.summary: Upload Open Banking Data (Inscribe Financial Data Format) (BETA)
post.description: Uploads Open Banking Data (Inscribe Financial Data Format) to an Inscribe customer (BETA). See our guide to submitting open banking data [here](https://docs.inscribe.ai/docs/submitting-open-banking-data).

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The Inscribe customer id.

requestBody.description: The Open Banking Data (Inscribe Financial Data Format) to be uploaded.

start_date.description: Refers to the beginning date of the data upload period. This should be in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format and represents the day from which the analysis will start at 00:00.

end_datetime.description: Marks the ending point of the data upload period. Unlike start_date, this must include both date and time in 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format, indicating the exact moment the period ends.

accounts.description: An array of objects, each representing a bank account with detailed information.

account_number.description: The unique identifier number for the account.

account_subtype.description: More specific type of the account within the general category.

available_balance.description: The available balance in the account at the end of the data period, including any pending transactions.

balance.description: The current total balance of the account at the end of the data period, excluding any pending transactions.

currency_code.description: The ISO currency code representing the currency of the account.

guid.description: A globally unique identifier for the account, given by the requester.

institution_name.description: The name of the financial institution where the account is held.

owners.description: An array of objects representing the owners of the account.

address.description: The address of the account owner.

name.description: The name of the account owner.

transactions.description: An array of transaction objects associated with the account.

amount.description: The amount of the transaction. Negative values refer to debit transactions, while positive values refer to credit transactions.

currency_code.description: The ISO currency code for the transaction.

date.description: The posted date of the transaction in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format. The posted date is when the transaction is processed and recorded by the bank in the account.

description.description: A brief description of the transaction.

guid.description: A globally unique identifier for the transaction, given by the requester.

post.description:
Uploads a Plaid Asset Report to a customer. Once a Plaid Asset Report is uploaded, it will be processed by Inscribes Credit Insights service which returns customer insights derived from the open banking data.

**Warning**  This endpoint is deprecated. The recommended endpoint is [Upload Plaid Asset Report Open Banking Data](https://docs.inscribe.ai/reference/uploadplaidassetreportopenbankingdata).

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The Inscribe customer id.

requestBody.description: The Plaid Asset Report to be uploaded. This data should be in the format of the GET response to a Plaid Asset Report request which is defined in [Plaid's documentation here](https://plaid.com/docs/api/products/assets/#asset_report-get-response-report)

asset_report_id.description: A unique identifier for the Asset Report.

client_report_id.description: A self-defined identifier for the Asset Report.

date_generated.description: The date and time of the Asset Report being generated.

days_requested.description: The duration the Asset Report corresponds to, in days.

user.description: The information supplied about the user prior to requesting the Asset Report.

items.description: Data returned by Plaid about each of the Items included in the Asset Report.

warnings.description: A list of errors relating to the Asset Report generation.

request_id.description: A unique identifier for the request.

200.description: Successfully created a new Plaid Asset Report.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Open Banking Data.

created_at.description: Time at which the Open Banking Data was created, in the format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ

state.description: The current state of the Open Banking Data, it has the following options: PROCESSING - This Open Banking Data is still being processed. PROCESSED - This Open Banking Data has finished processing and results are available. ERROR_PROCESSING - An error occurred while processing this Open Banking Data. CORRUPT_DATA_DETECTED - This Open Banking Data was found to contain corrupted data and could not be processed.

no_of_bank_accounts.description: The number of bank accounts present in the Open Banking Data. This value will be 0 until the data is in the PROCESSED state.

get.description: Retrieves the hierarchy of transaction categories that Inscribe uses in its transaction enrichment. Every uploaded transaction will be assigned one of these transaction categories (or null if no category is found). Inscribe categories are presented in the form of a hierarchy. More information is available via our [guides](https://docs.inscribe.ai/docs/how-are-transactions-enriched).

subcategories.description: List of all subcategories for this category.

get.description:
Returns a list of transactions for a customer. The list is sorted by data source, with transactions from bank statements listed first, followed by transactions from open banking data. Within each of the data sources, the transactions are ordered by creation date, with the most recently created transactions appearing first.
Most query parameters should be passed only once for filtering. However, there are two exceptions:

  - `category`: This parameter can be passed multiple times to filter transactions by category.
  - `data_source`: This parameter can also be passed multiple times to filter transactions by data source.

Please refer to the individual parameter descriptions for more details on usage.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: The Inscribe customer id.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Set the number of transactions to be returned by request.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Send a cursor to retrieve the next set of transactions, starting after the cursor. If no cursor is sent, the first set of transactions will be returned.

parameters.name: transaction_ids
parameters.description: Filter transactions to include only those with the specified transaction IDs. To filter by multiple transaction IDs, separate each ID with a comma (,). For example, `transaction_ids=uuid1,uuid2`.

parameters.name: document_ids
parameters.description: Filter transactions to include only those from the specified document IDs. To filter by multiple document IDs, separate each ID with a comma (,). For example, `document_ids=uuid1,uuid2`. No transactions from open banking data will be returned.

parameters.name: document_pages
parameters.description: Filter transactions to include only those that exist on specific pages of documents. To filter by multiple pages, separate each page number with a comma (,). For examples, `document_pages=1,2`. No transactions from open banking data will be returned.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Filter transactions where the description or merchant contains the specified search term.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Specify the field by which transactions should be sorted.

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Choose between 'ascending' or 'descending' to define the sorting order.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Filter transactions to include only those with a date greater than or equal to the specified start date.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Filter transactions to include only those with a date less than the specified end date.

parameters.name: min_amount
parameters.description: Filter transactions to include only those with an amount greater than or equal to the specified minimum amount.

parameters.name: max_amount
parameters.description: Filter transactions to include only those with an amount less than the specified maximum amount.

parameters.name: data_source
parameters.description: Set a data source by which to filter transactions. Only transactions in this data source will be returned. If no data source is set, all transactions will be returned.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Set a category by which to filter transactions. Only transactions in this category will be returned. If no category is set, all transactions will be returned.

parameters.name: include_unreconciled_documents
parameters.description: Unreconciled bank accounts are bank accounts where the difference between the parsed opening and closing balances is not explained by the sum of the parsed transaction amounts. Bank accounts are typically unreconciled if the uploaded document has poor quality or is missing some of its original pages. It can also happen when the parsing models fail to parse and extract all relevant data. If this parameter is set to False, documents with unreconciled bank accounts will be excluded from the credit insights. This parameter defaults to True, keeping all documents included.

200.description: Returns back a list of Transaction objects.

items.description: A transaction object which contains information about the transaction.

guid.description: An identifier for the transaction submitted by the data provider.

category.description: Category of the transaction. This value will be set to null if no category is identified.

method.description: Method by which the transaction was made. This value will be set to null if no method is identified.

vendor.description: This has been deprecated. Please use merchant instead.

merchant.description: The merchant associated with the transaction. This value will be set to null if no merchant is identified.

data_source.description: The source of the transaction. The transaction can be from either a bank statement or open banking data.

data.description: A map with a data property that contains an array of transactions. Each entry in the array is a separate transaction object.

cursor.description: A cursor for use in pagination. This cursor is to be used in the next request's cursor parameter to request the next set of transactions.

metadata.description: Additional data which provides context about Inscribe's Credit Insights response.

customer_contains_low_trust_documents.description: This value will be set to True if the customer contains any documents under a trust score threshold of 50. Else,  this will be set to False.

included_data_sources.description: Lists all documents and open banking data which were used to create the Inscribe Credit Insights.

excluded_data_sources.description: Lists all documents and open banking data which were excluded from the Inscribe Credit Insights. Documents can be excluded if they are duplicate documents, or when the include_unreconciled_documents query parameter is set to False.

query_parameters.description: Lists the query parameters which were used in the original endpoint request.

get.description:
By querying this endpoint, you can check if it's possible to reach Inscribe's services from your own infrastructure. This endpoint does not require any authentication but is rate limited.
It does not indicate that all services are working without an error. For those notifications, please subscribe to our status page at <https://status.inscribe.ai>.

schema.description: Response for the reachability check endpoint

429.description: Too many requests. The request has been rate limited. For more information, visit our [documentation on rate limiting](https://docs.inscribe.ai/docs/are-the-endpoints-rate-limited).

text/plain.example: Requests are limited to 200 requests over a 5 minute period. Please try again in 30 seconds

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the request.
